net.java.jddac.jmdi.util
Class JddacStartup

java.lang.Object
  net.java.jddac.jmdi.util.JddacStartup
All Implemented Interfaces:
ConfigurationInterface
public class JddacStartup
extends java.lang.Object
implements ConfigurationInterface

Retrieve configuration settings and deploy them. It does the following:

  • loads a configuration from persistent storage.
  • examines the configuration and prompts user for settings if necessary, saving any changes.
  • instantiates and configures appropriate objects. If the ncap instanceName field is blank or 'prompt' then the config dialog is presented for entry.

    doStartup

    public static boolean doStartup(ArgArray defaults,
                                QuerySettingsInterface queryInterface,
                                boolean forceInput,
                                boolean initialLoad)
    Create and initialize a JDDAC Client Configuration.

    Parameters:
    defaults - - An ArgArray specifying default settings. See QuerySettingsInterface for details.
    queryInterface - - An instance of QuerySettingsInterface.
    forceInput - - true if the user should always be prompted.
    initialLoad - - true if the configuration should be applied. This is normally set true for a first time load and false when just the user entry portion should be performed.
    Returns:
    true if the configuration was sucessfully loaded. false otherwise.

    wipePersistentConfig

    public static void wipePersistentConfig()
    Remove any persistent configuration previously stored by JddacStartup.

    configure

    public void configure(ArgArray configuration)
               throws java.lang.Exception
    Description copied from interface: ConfigurationInterface
    Provides a method to configure object properties. The registry argument contains an ArgArray composed named values. Any values that are not specified are assumed to be left unchanged. That is, if a value is not present, do not assume it means 0 or true or some other default. This allows the configure method to be used to set a single value without affecting other values.

    Specified by:
    configure in interface ConfigurationInterface
    Parameters:
    configuration - contains incoming configuration parameters as named values.

    Name Default Description
    JddacStartup.persist (none) A Vector of ArgArrays. Each ArgArray contains an instanceName field as well as any other configuration applicable to the referenced object. The settings are stored in non-volatile storage. If the new settings are are not different from what is already stored, a storage operation is not requested.
    JddacStartup.apply false A boolean true or false. When true, the configuration provided by JddacStartup.persist is applied to the system via method.
    Throws:
    java.lang.Exception
    See Also:
    ConfigurationInterface.configure(net.java.jddac.common.type.ArgArray)
